@cihypt In our company, the reps get paid according to the work they bring in. We have both male and female representatives working on our team. The ONLY reason one gender makes more than the other is simply the amount of time they put in and the amount of business they bring and nothing more. Most females that work with us have a family and children thus they can not put in the hours men can because of taking care of their families, some women that are single and have no obligations make as much and sometimes even more than the men. It’s that simple. So your comments are very true and correct.

@mariana.lynnr first of all, i did not say that women do not belong in high level jobs. I said that more men than women have the personality traits that fit e.g. a Manager career and more women than men have the personality traits that fit e.g. nursing. That is not the same thing. Okay, women face difficulties breaking into some high level positions, i agree on that. What about men? They do not face the same difficulties? Don't they have to compete against others too? Don't they have to compete against others, mostly men, that made the pursuit of a high level career their main goal in live and are willing to work 70 hours or more a week for a high monthly income? Women and Men have to compete similarly to get to the top. And men, who compete will do everything to get an advantage, they are also more likely to use unfair ways and do things that will make others dislike them, they are usually not very agreeable. Women usually are agreeable, thats the biggest additional difficulty they face competing for a high end career. Encourage women to be disagreeable in the workplace when needed and they will more easily get to the top. But there is no one preventing women to get to the top because they are women - and if: go to court.

@colinsurya you can’t deny that there are people today who still think that women need to be financially dependent on their male counterpart. it’s a minority, but it’s still there. this generation in america has been found to be moving away from the traditional family structure and spending more time working and less time devoted to traditional gender roles like cooking and cleaning alone. For you to say that men belonging in high level jobs and women belonging in their own jobs being based in biology is simply incorrect, 78% of female business owners in this study (https://www.inc.com/minda-zetlin/women-entrepreneurs-pay-gap-freshbooks-survey-28-percent-less-than-men.html) said they’re happier working as a business owner than as an employee. women enjoy high level positions but many find it difficult to break into these fields because they’re not taken as seriously as men, therefore, it comes back to more than just biology restricting women in the workforce.

@mariana.lynnr @cihypt Please girls, don't get personal. Mariana, you said that the social tendency towards men having high level positions and women bearing the brunt on homemaking and child rearing is based in sexism. And I think that is wrong. You as a women do not get punished for pursuing a high level career and not having babies. It is your own decision to do what other people expect you to do. Though in Scandinavia, where the law is the most egalitarian law in the world, the differences in occupation between men and women became the biggest, which indicates that womens and mens interests are biologically based and that the Gender-roles at the workplace are NOT socially constructed. Your Argument is invalid. Also, women taking less shifts then men is not a sexist assumption, it is a statistic fact. According to the United States Department of Labor the number of women working parttime is close to twice as high as the number of men working parttime. You can look it up here: https://www.bls.gov/cps/cpsaat08.htm

@mariana.lynnr @mariana.lynnr 🤣🤣🤣🤣 you’re one angry and miserable little girl. May you find happiness in your life. I can promise you, you won’t be running anything lol weak girls like you are to fragile to run anything 😊. Gnight

yeeeeah I don’t think so. by the time i’m your age you’ll hopefully be too senile to spew this useless mysogynistic and insulting shit at anyone ever again and i’ll be living it up with hopefully no kids (you know, can’t be wiping asses when i’m busy wiping out business competition)

@mariana.lynnr actually by giving him positive messages instead of tearing him down he’s become incredibly respectful of women... but if you look statistically men are instead starting to avoid women at record numbers thanks to people like you. 
Regardless you seem to be unable to understand how public interactions occur and the the degree to which they should affect you... you are not entitled to exist in public and demand every person around you meet your own personal requirements of what’s acceptable and not acceptable. If someone says something you dislike... move on... it doesn’t make you a victim... you my dear... are not a victim... It’s scary to see you are so fragile you can’t handle public interactions and feel entitled to demand society control others behaviors toward you in public yet believe you and others like you are equipped to run a company... or a country... the women who become ceos are not broken because a guy says they have a nice ass in public... lol this is your big struggle in life??? This further makes my point about intersectionality and your complete disconnect of what minority women from neighborhoods like where I was born actually go through.... Don’t worry about my kids I’m really worried about whatever future kids you have much more... but I’m sure by the time you are my age you will be alone and miserable 🤔

@cihypt I’m sorry all of that happened to you and your boyfriend, because it should never happen to anyone ever, male or female. why should women even HAVE to feel uncomfortable because of shit like this in public?! let me tell you, people exactly like you are the reason it still happens. wouldn’t be surprised if your son is the next generation of men who think they’re entitled to a woman’s attention when she’s just minding her own business thanks to this wonderful influence of his.

@mariana.lynnr I’ve experienced that and worse... from men and women... so has my boyfriend who is a victim of being date raped and hospitalized by a woman... The difference between you and I is as long as they are not touching me it’s not abuse... the law agrees... you are in public. If a construction worker saying you have a nice ass has traumatized you this much my point remains the same... you are weak. 
My boyfriend is a very handsome guy and I’ve seen girls be disgustingly forward with him... I’ve also seen countless men be incredibly polite and sweet to women only to be met with disgusting insults... And what construction worker is following you for ten minutes??? Thy are working lol... if a random dude tries to follow you for ten minutes in public just tell them to leave you alone or call the cops... studies show women who are uncomfortable in public have immediate responses and help from both men and women around who view it...

@cihypt ah yes, I LOVE when random gross men on the street compliment my ass and then tell me to smile and then literally follow me for ten minutes when i don’t. true story! I hope you never have to experience it, because only somebody who has never been targeted would ever reduce street harassment to “complimenting me in public”

@mariana.lynnr glad to see you pull back from the rape comparison despite you having made these comments over and over... but being in public and someone talking to you is not abuse either (as you now put it lol)

Only in the mind of a fragile broken weak person is hearing someone compliment you in public so traumatizing that it’s abuse... It’s an indicator you should go get professional help

@cihypt catcalling is a form of verbal harassment. very literally. this country is a shitstain compared to other developed nations and so is the president, who is himself a misogynistic piece of shit and likely has assaulted women, making it more and more that way every day. rape is rape, verbal abuse is verbal abuse. you’d follow along more closely if you didn’t try to frankenstein my sentences together.

@mariana.lynnr funny how you mentioned ad hominems and are now jumping at the most ridiculous talking points. I have three kids and they are awesome. Two are in college and one is in high school... I know I look twenty five but it’s because I am happy :) My son treats women with all the respect in the world... and my daughters are empowered... they don’t see themselves as little victims like you... Nice job tracking back on all the insane comments you’ve made about rape, this country, men, etc... I’m glad to see you quite literally have nothing to say to defend your insane comments...
@cihypt let’s see how your kid/ kids grow up with a mom who doesn’t think men need to be help responsible for how they act. some world you’re setting them up to live in huh.

@mariana.lynnr you literally just wrote that catcalling is a form of rape and verbal abuse... now you cLiam you didn’t... you are either clinically insane or actually too stupid to remember what you are literally writing... Your other post claims men dominate and rape whoever they want... again... your insane words... not mine.. You also wrote this country is a shitstain and also very clearly attacked motherhood... The fact you believe a construction worker hollaring out at you is traumatizing and “verbal abuse” which is in your own words “is a form of rape” pretty clearly shows what an entitled insane inexperienced brainwashed zombie you are... And yes you are a rich privileged white girl who has clearly never experienced any real hardship and sadly also never learned how to actually analyze data so that you could form an educated rational opinion...

@cihypt once again, I did not equate rape with catcalling?? I mean I know you’re dense but I didn’t think you were that incapable of following basic conversation. I don’t see you throwing any factual data behind your points either, all I keep hearing are useless comments that “you’re a white girl who rides so you can’t care about social equality” and “you don’t know what intersectionality is” so I can’t exactly say a bibliography would be of much use to you

@mariana.lynnr by the way there were no ad hominem attacks... you literally demonstrated time and time again that you do not understand what a multi variable study is... that you do not understand or value intersectionality... You did quite literally call this country a shitstain... attack motherhood and did make a comment that “all men do is dominate society and rape whoever they want”... You have now equated catcalling to rape... which is not only insane but incredibly offensive to rape victims and shows a bias so extreme in your views that no mentally sane person could even attempt to debate with you... If privilege is something you are so concerned about in society you should worry about your owner heavily privileged life... You literally creeped on every positive comment here to try and say something negative... you are insane lol. I’m glad you have enough time and money to do that 🤣🤣🤣 must be nice to have a rich white dad who worked hard to provide for his spoiled daughter.

@mariana.lynnr you pretend to miss my point, cause you have no factual data to refute it with lol. That fact that your equating catcalling with rape proves my point. All you do is spew nonsense talking points you’ve heard from your professors or on tv. you honestly  sound like a robot at this point. Keep pretending you’re a victim it can only get you so far in life. Gnight 🤣

you wonder why I “miss” the point of your comments but there’s just so much bullshit to unpack that I don’t bother. considering that entire last section was full of ad hominem attacks and nothing of actual substance i’m gonna skip right along and say yeah, maybe more women will start picking up intense labor jobs once men stop assaulting them and violating them in the workplace. i don’t think all men do is rape and dominate, not a chance. but ever been catcalled and verbally assaulted by construction workers on a smoke break sitting in a big pack on the sidewalk? oh yeah, thats right, that’s why women don’t work hands on. because it’s still okay for men to make workplaces like that threatening for them, which all goes back to societal sexist tendencies and is exactly the thing gillette was trying to bring attention to (which was my original point two days ago on this garbage imovie video).

@cihypt the feminist movement is destroying women’s happiness?! wow do you really need to get outside and grab a breath of fresh air. more women than EVER are taking on high level high paying jobs and having complex careers rather than being forced to give up their last names and wipe kids asses all day. more women are breaking into the fortune 500 club. more women are having safe and legal abortions and getting legal action taken against their rapists and DOMINATING politics and they’re all women who understand that things are not good enough the way they are, and it’s all because of the collective strength of women working together and demanding a better future. women of all backgrounds and economic standings and races and sexualities, coming together regardless of their differences.

@mariana.lynnr your entire argument is based in generalizations and even more so incredibly false data... if your trying to say that humans are individuals and that generalizations based on race, and class are not relevant to these discussions then neither is gender... your race and privilege are a part of this discussion... you don’t get to choose what aspects aren’t... You seem incredibly defensive of your privilege... And again... completely ignorant on what multi variable studies are... something I learned in great detail working in a hospital environment and can use to look at other studies... educate yourself. It was literally my job to analyze these things in the hospital... what you are preaching is false... plain and simple... We make different life choices then men... that’s not a bad thing... the determining factor of a good life is not how much money you make... I see my man coming home exhausted everyday to provide for us... I’d make the same amount if I did his job... I don’t want to... I’m lucky he is willing to... that’s the case for most women which is why the deviation in pay exists... that’s not sexism... Are there sexist men out there? Sure... but just as you said they are individuals... and this notion of systemic sexism forcing women in to jobs that pay less is a fallacy and the feminist movement is destroying women’s happiness...

@mariana.lynnr you really seem unable to understand my point about intersectionality... After working as Director of Human Resources, I made enough money to buy a few Properties and now I live pretty comfortable. Most girls (myself included) like being caretakers which is why my boyfriend is out working 60 to 70 hours a week and I’m at home caring for our family... thats not something that needs restructuring... women are choosing these things and there are tons of studies showing that the women who make choices similar to mine are significantly happier... societal pressure to “restructure” women to work more hours for the sake of “making more” is absurd... you are ignoring biology... we are different and want different things. There are countless reasons for the gap and it doesn’t have to do with sexism... that’s a random factor attributed by feminists with zero data to support it... And keep saying you don’t need to apologize for your upbringing and how valid your opinion is about these issues while talking down to a woman of color who literally grew up in the worst conditions and still managed to overcome... yes your loved experiences, race and class intersect on these issues... you should go educate yourself on just how relevant that is to this debate. It’s real easy to sit there and say it doesn’t matter from your position.
@cihypt I am not attacking you based on what you’ve said about your life. i’m speaking to you one person to another, leave my life out of it

@cihypt I’m choosing to ignore the fact that you’re making assumptions about my life because i acknowledge my privilege but i’m not here to defend myself to you, like I said before. and I didn’t say she was sexist. I said the SOCIAL TENDENCY toward men having more high level positions and women bearing the brunt of homemaking and child rearing that was noted in the study was based in sexism and therefore the STUDY was centered upon a society that INHERENTLY has different standards and expectations for the two genders. what I said was that rebalancing society and job structure in terms of social expectations was the way out of the difference in earnings.

@mariana.lynnr your dad is the whitest guy I’ve ever seen... your mom at most is a completely white Puerto Rican woman and you are white... don’t be embarrassed about being white and growing up in the upper east side being rich... go preach elsewhere... you wanna pretend privilege only matters where you want it to... middle class? With horses and houses and apartments in the upper east side? Listen... it’s all good you should be happy you are rich and white and don’t need to suffer realities minorities actually face but don’t sit and preach on your High horse ignoring your own very real privileges while pretending that you and other women like you have it so hard...

@mariana.lynnr a feminist woman who works as the first head of economics at Harvard is now “sexist” because she compiled data disproving the gender pay gap myth... even traditional first and second wave feminists feminists disproved it lol... If you have the Same education and work the same hours you are paid the same... Her finding shows women choose jobs with benefits over pay... less hours... etc... and many women after 35 work significantly less hours than men...
Men also take much more dangerous jobs that pay more... I’m glad you think that’s “sexist”... that women making their own choices to have happier lives instead of working 60 hour weeks in dangerous jobs is “sexist” to women 🤣🤣🤣 I worked Human Resources in a hospital and was hired over every guy who applied... coming from the Bronx and made a good living for myself and am happy... cuz I don’t see myself as a victim... but I suppose you growing up with horses and being super rich and white must have been so hard that you need to create issues that don’t exist to feel like you have value... You are the problem in this world... not men.

@cihypt seriously? what the fuck is wrong with me growing up middle class and still caring about social issues? I’m a (puerto rican, actually) human being, but suddenly i’m not allowed to care about fucking anything?

@mariana.lynnr btw your race and class has given you a lot more privilege than gender does so your hypocrisy on saying it’s not relevant is something. You should go check... it must be convenient to say you don’t need to defend your experiences lol... it’s because you were raised in the upper east side with horses and money and now need something to complain about... go check your privilege.

Nothing more annoying then a rich white liberal girl telling minorities that their race and money  ain’t relevant to the conversation lol...

@mariana.lynnr so you are claiming privilege does not exist? 
Interesting considering you claim gender is a privilege but you clearly being super rich and white doesn’t afford you any privilege... for someone who claims to be so educated you seem to not understand intersectionality...also the hypocrisy of your last statement while also claiming you “fight for minority women” is utterly disgusting... You are right you should leave because you have yet to make a single intelligent comment and also fail to understand in the most basic level what a multi variable study actually is which is simply embarrassing for you.

the study you cited mentions that the reason women get paid less is because of different situations in which they work less time or their paychecks are otherwise misrepresented in studies of this type. her findings are literally grounded in a sexist assumption that women are the ones taking less shifts and staying home with kids or whatever. so LITERALLY, this woman is stating that women earn less in virtually every job. if you think past a basic middle school level of thought on that one, there’s a pretty direct correlation between the pay gap and the fact that society has for the longest time pressured women to be the ones at home, as opposed to men. i don’t know if you’ve read your own study but goldin has actually literally stated that the pay gap exists, but because jobs are structured differently and give the advantage to men, who work the “better” hours and positions. it all comes back to systematic sexism, only when we restructure to equally provide opportunities to all genders will we be able to close it.

@cihypt my upbringing doesn’t have anything to do with this and neither does yours. i’m not wasting my time defending my life to you. important issues are important issues, just because I was born into one situation or another doesn’t make me any less qualified to compile experience and research to understand issues i’ve personally experienced much less than other people

@mariana.lynnr you grew up in Manhattan with horses I grew up In The Bronx 🤣🤣🤣 girl please... And the reason you are paid the same is not because you made sure to get paid the same... it’s because a. And I read your study... it is not a multi variable study. I can repeat this over and over but again you are so self obsessed and need to see yourself as a victim that no amount of fact will get through to you.

@cihypt guess what? I grew up in manhattan, ALSO with immigrant family. and i’ve been paid equally too because I work with entities that publicly recognize social disadvantages like pay gaps and workplace harassment and combat them. i’m assuming you didn’t even take a look at what I linked because it very clearly juxtaposes different variables, so you can go ahead and stop wasting your time trying to debunk my claims on lack of variability. i’m not saying i’m being paid unfairly because i’ve made sure i’m not. i’m speaking towards other women, especially impoverished women who basically have to take what they can get, whose workplaces are unsafe and unfair and DON’T follow the laws that attempt to address that.

@mariana.lynnr her name is Claudia Goldin... she’s one of countless people to address this... again the only studies which are very few to show a relevant gap are ones that do not take in to account all variables. To date every economist who has done multi variable studies has the same result aka the men and women are paid within a 95 percentile the same... This has been examined by literally every single major economist and the results are always identical... you can keep posting studies that do not do multi variable research it doesn’t actually make any point... It’s clear you want to believe you are paid less than a man for the same hours worked... it’s completely factually inaccurate.. you want to be a victim despite reality literally disproving you when analyzed in a rational scientific way... It’s clear that’s how you see yourself... I grew up in the Bronx, immigrant parents and worked hard. I make the same as the men who work the same hours as me... I’m the norm... there are already laws in place to prevent women from being paid less lol...

@amandaneumeyer_ men are more often perpetrators, yes, thats true. But that does not change the fact that they are more often victims than women are and that they deserve help and awareness for their problems. Something most people dont know about the rape thing: in Germany, scientists estimate 20 percent of all the sexual assault accusations as false. 20 percent. There is a list of miscarriages of justice at german Wikipedia. False rape-accusations against men account for half (!) the miscarriages on that list. There is awareness about womens issues, but not about mens issues. Rape is bad, no doubt. But the accusation of rape is bad too and it happens often. But everytime someone is accused of rape, most people just act like everything is already proven and the mean man raped the poor, weak woman. I have never experienced a reaction like "that bitch falsely accused him of rape and made him spent a lot of time in prison." after an accusation was proven to be false.

@mariana.lynnr you have to ask why wage inequality exists. If it exists because of sexism, its a problem. But how significant is sexism for the GPG? Not that much. Break the wage gap down by occupation, working years, part-time oder fulltime, etc and you will end up with a GPG of 2 Percent (Germany). These 2 Percent are caused by personality traits, carrer decisions sexism and other factors. So in total sexism accounts for less than 1 percent of GPG. Less than one percent. If the new iphone is 1 percent off, thats not really an argument for buying it, is it? Why is the GPG of less than 1 percent of any significance? The GPG of self-employed people is 43 percent in germany - and those people do not have any sexist employer. It's only their personality traits and their business decisions that account for the GPG. If you really want to help women to get higher paid jobs and further their career, encourage them to adopt the personality traits they need for that. Teach them to be competitive, to be disagreeable and to put effort into their work. You need to adopt some of the personality traits of men, in order to compete them, just like men have to adopt womens personality traits like compassion and sensitiveness to compete with women in jobs like nursing.

@mariana.lynnr Don't act like a victim. Women's problems are way more often discussed in public, though they are way less significant. How bad is being called "sweety" by a man compared to not being allowed to visit your children and still having to pay alimony? How significant is a GPG of 2 percent, which is mainly caused by womens and mens behavior at the work place and different personality traits like agreeableness and NOT by sexism, compared to the number of men dying at the workplace? In what way are your reproductive rights any more important than men's reproductive rights and the right of the fetus to live? Nowadays there is the pill, there are condoms, there are other ways of birth control and there is the right to abort during the first months of pregnancy. Where is there any violation of your reproductive rights? Men's problems do not get the attention they deserve. Womens problems matter, but mens problems matter equally. And if radical feminists and the media didn't create an image of weak, oppressed women and a patriarchy of mean, white men, people would look at gender specific problems and would try to solve them sorted by significance and men's problems would get the attention they needed.

@amandaneumeyer_ I am unsure where you are getting your statistics but even the most bias, man hating studies came back with significantly less than 1 in 3 women... the most commonly used claim is the 1 in 5 college study which was not analyzing rape but sexual assault... and 70 percent of women polled did not know or feel like they were victims prior to the study... questions included ridiculous ambiguous questions... never mind that upward of 90 percent of people who were asked to be part of the study refused... Claiming 1 in 3 women are raped is utter insanity and part of the problem... claims like that damage your position not help it... also a small small minority of men are responsible for rape... they are repeat offenders... This is the narrative this video is calling out... 99 percent of men know not to rape and are disgusted by it... 70 percent of child related deaths are from women we don’t see campaigns about toxic femininity and telling women to stop being murderers. 
As a woman with a son and a wonderful man in my life and seeing these men demonized.

79% of men are homicide victims but 96% of homicides are committed by men. Men are amazing and I'm not saying men are trash but all Gillette was trying to say is 1 in 3 women are raped let's not do that. While we're at it let's just all respect each other and this stuff wouldn't be happening
